articles.headline: Greek Rail System’s Debt Adds to Economic Woes
articles.snippet: The state-owned railway loses about $3.8 million a day, prompting a search for solutions: maybe a foreign investor or a complete overhaul.
articles.abstract: The state-owned railway loses about $3.8 million a day, prompting a search for solutions: maybe a foreign investor or a complete overhaul.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATHENS  In 2009, bankers for Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley pitched the Greek government on a plan to overhaul its money-losing railway system. Among the ideas was to lay off half of the system’s 7,000 workers and have the government take on roughly half of the company’s 8 billion euros in debt.

articles.headline: With Sale of Assets, BP Bets on More Deep Wells
articles.snippet: The company agreed to sell $7 billion of oil and gas fields to the Apache Corporation. The move will help raise the $20 billion it said it would put in escrow to pay claims for the oil spill.
articles.abstract: The company agreed to sell $7 billion of oil and gas fields to the Apache Corporation. The move will help raise the $20 billion it said it would put in escrow to pay claims for the oil spill.
articles.lead_paragraph: Despite the April 20 Deepwater Horizon disaster, BP has no plans to leave the Gulf of Mexico or stop drilling for oil in other deep ocean waters.

articles.headline: Water Dispute Increases India-Pakistan Tension
articles.snippet: A battle over a dam threatens to upset delicate negotiations to renew peace talks on Kashmir.
articles.abstract: A battle over a dam threatens to upset delicate negotiations to renew peace talks on Kashmir.
articles.lead_paragraph: BANDIPORE, Kashmir — In this high Himalayan valley on the Indian-controlled side of Kashmir, the latest battle line between India and Pakistan has been drawn.
articles.byline: By Lydia Polgreen and Sabrina Tavernise

articles.headline: F.D.A. Panel Urges Limits for Avastin
articles.snippet: An advisory committee recommended revoking federal approval of the drug as a treatment for breast cancer.
articles.abstract: An advisory committee recommended revoking federal approval of the drug as a treatment for breast cancer.
articles.lead_paragraph: An advisory committee recommended on Tuesday that the Food and Drug Administration revoke approval of the drug Avastin as a treatment for breast cancer, saying the drug was not helping patients.

articles.headline: Maine Giving Social Security Another Look
articles.snippet: Some states provide retirement benefits for their employees solely from their state pension programs, but Maine, spurred by costs, is considering changes.
articles.abstract: Some states provide retirement benefits for their employees solely from their state pension programs, but Maine, spurred by costs, is considering changes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers in Maine have found an unusual tool for tackling their state’s pension woes: Social Security.

articles.headline: Britain’s Leader Carves Identity as Budget Cutter
articles.snippet: After 10 weeks in office, David Cameron has emerged as one of the most activist prime ministers in modern times.
articles.abstract: After 10 weeks in office, David Cameron has emerged as one of the most activist prime ministers in modern times.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — In the five years David Cameron spent rebuilding the Conservative Party in opposition, opinion polls showed that as he sought to rebrand it by offering a compassionate but persistently fuzzy image, voters had trouble defining what sort of a prime minister he would make.

articles.headline: Overcome by Heat and Inertia
articles.snippet: If this Congress can’t pass a major climate bill, and the odds are not great, you have to wonder about the future of climate policy.
articles.abstract: If this Congress can’t pass a major climate bill, and the odds are not great, you have to wonder about the future of climate policy.

articles.headline: Eyewear, With a Bit of Disney and a Touch of Apple
articles.snippet: Luxottica’s new style of eyeglasses store is intended, in part, to resist the siphoning of customers by discount chains and online shopping.
articles.abstract: Luxottica’s new style of eyeglasses store is intended, in part, to resist the siphoning of customers by discount chains and online shopping.
articles.lead_paragraph: A wind tunnel. A concierge. A store that’s shaped like an eyeball.
